title: How to Say Thank You in Turkish

steps.title: Learn the word for Thank You.
steps.content: Learn the word for Thank You. "Thank you" is written like Teşekkür ederim. [1] X Research source It's pronounced Teh-sheh-kull-erh Ed-erh-im. Practice saying the words out loud, slowly first, until you perfect it. It's best to learn how to write the words as well. Try perfecting the first part first before learning the second part.

steps.title: Listen to the words.
steps.content: Listen to the words. If you're visiting Turkey or Cyprus, there will be a lot of Turkish people around. [2] X Research source Unfortunately, not all of them will speak English. Try asking a tour guide how to say "thank you" or ask a friend to talk you through it. Don't be embarrassed about it, Turkish people will be flattered that you're learning their language.

steps.title: If you have no friends that speak Turkish, going to Google Translate could help.
steps.content: If you have no friends that speak Turkish, going to Google Translate could help. [3] X Research source Select the language. You want English to Turkish. Type in thank you in the left box, entitled "English." On the right, the word Teşekkür ederim should appear in a gray box. In the bottom right of the box, there is a speaker logo. Click here to hear the word being said.

steps.title: Practice all the time.
steps.content: Practice all the time. This can be done by repeating the word to yourself, repeating the word to a Turkish speaking friend and asking them if you're getting it right, or just thanking people in Turkey or Northern Cyprus when they do something nice to you. [4] X Research source Even if you don't get it perfect, they will know what you mean.
